question.q: Automatic updates are grayed out for me, how come?
question.a: Automatic updates in 5.4 through to at least 5.8 have been disabled in Vista / Windows 7, as they require administrative privileges. Hopefully a fix will appear soon, to start a UAC prompt on these OSes if the user has admin privileges.

question.q: I see from the website there's a new version, but I haven't got a notification to update yet. Even if I click "Update Notepad++" it doesn't update, what's going on?
question.a: The file that says what version is "current", lies on the website, and is manually updated. This update is done, when the release is considered stable enough - that can take any amount of time, depending on how stable the first release in a line is. There was a change in the gup.exe around the time 5.4 due to a change in the way SF downloads works, so versions prior to that will not auto-update.
